POB-EYE2 Library

v1.O

Introduction:

The POB-EYE2 Library provides various functions to use the pobeye2 hardware:
  • input/output functions (with digital I/O),
  • communications protocols (I2C bus and uart),
  • camera sensor and recognition function (Camera sensor and Recognition),
  • and various utils functions (Read/Write flash, Utils, Timer and Clock ...)

The POB-EYE2 hardware:

  • 64K of RAM.
  • 128K of Flash memory to store your program.
  • 2 UART.
  • 1 I2C.
  • 1 camera sensor that provide color frame of a size 160 x 120 pixels.
  • 11 input/output pins.

Using the library:

First, You have to install the WinARM compiler and the PobTools.

Example Code: 

 #include <pob-eye.h>

int main(void)
{
        InitPobeye2();
        InitUART0(115200);

        SendString("Hello world from POB-EYE2!");

        while(1) ;      

        return 0;
}

How to upload a new program into POBEYE2:

The POB-EYE2 microcontroller has a bootloader that allows upload new programs. To go in bootloader mode, you have to:
  • Turn off the POB-EYE2.
  • Press the reset button and power on.

Now you can upload a new program into the memory.

Examples

You can find POB-EYE2 examples code on your computer at this location:

C:/Program Files/POB-Technology/PobTools/examples
